tit.e: Chihara Kitsunezuka-kofun Tumulus (a tumulus in Chihara, Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture)
Chihara Kitsunezuka-kofun Tumulus (a tumulus in Chihara, Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture)

sen.j: 茅原狐塚古墳（ちはらきつねづかこふん）は奈良県桜井市茅原にある古墳。
sen.e: Chihara Kitsunezuka Tumulus is a tumulus in Chihara, Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture.
Chihara Kitsunezuka-kofun Tumulus is a tumulus in Chihara, Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: Chihara Kitsunezuka-kofun Tumulus is a tumulus in Chihara, Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 墳丘は失われており巨石を用いた石室部分が露出している。
sen.e: Its grave mound has gone and the rock chamber is exposed.
Its grave mound has gone and the megalithic stone chamber is exposed.
Its grave mound has gone and the megalithic stone chamber is exposed.

sen.j: 地元では狐塚と呼ばれているが、同名の古墳と区別するため字名をつけて呼称する。
sen.e: Locally it is called Kitsunezuka; however here it is referred to with its Azamei (alias) to distinguish it from a tumulus of the same name.
Locally it is called Kitsunezuka; however here it is referred to with its Azamei (alias) to distinguish it from a tumulus of the same name.
Locally it is called Kitsunezuka; however here it is referred to with its Azamei (alias) to distinguish it from a tumulus of the same name.

sen.j: 封土はほとんど失われており墳丘の正確な形は不明である。
sen.e: Its exact shape is not known as its hodo (covering soil) is gone.
Its exact shape is not known as its hodo (covering soil) is almost gone.
Its exact shape is not known as its hodo (covering soil) is almost gone.

sen.j: 一辺40メートル以上の方墳ではないかと推測されている。
sen.e: It is assumed it used to be a square tumulus of side 40 meters or more.
It is assumed to be a square barrow of side 40 meters or more.
It is assumed to be a square barrow of side 40 meters or more.

sen.j: 石室は花崗岩を用いて南に開口した両袖式の横穴式石室である。
sen.e: Its rock chamber is a horizontal stone chamber made of granite which opens to the south.
The granite horizontal stone chamber is south opened ryosode-style (a stone chamber with the passage connected the center of the wall of burial chamber).
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ。「両袖式の」を補足し表現を変えました。
sen.e: The granite horizontal stone chamber is south opened ryosode-style (a stone chamber with the passage connected the center of the wall of burial chamber).

sen.j: 全長は17.3メートル、玄室の長さ6.0メートル・幅2.6メートル・高さ3.2メートル、羨道部分の長さ11.3メートル・幅2.1メートルである。
sen.e: The total length of the tumulus is 17.3 m; the burial chamber is 6.0 m in length, 2.6 m in width, and 3.2 m in height; and its passage is 11.3 m in length and 2.1 m in width.

The total length of the tumulus is 17.3 meters; the burial chamber is 6.0 meters in length, 2.6 meters in width, and 3.2 meters in height; and its passage is 11.3 meters in length and 2.1 meters in width.

The total length of the tumulus is 17.3 meters; the burial chamber is 6.0 meters in length, 2.6 meters in width, and 3.2 meters in height; and its passage is 11.3 meters in length and 2.1 meters in width.

sen.j: 奈良県内でも屈指の大きさである。
sen.e: It is an outstanding tumulus in Nara Prefecture in size.
It is an outstanding tumulus in Nara Prefecture in size.
It is an outstanding tumulus in Nara Prefecture in size.

sen.j: 石室の構造が水泥北古墳（御所市）とよく似ており、同一の設計によるものではないかと指摘されている。
sen.e: Since the structure of rock chamber is very similar to that of Midoro Kita Tumulus (Gose City), it is said to be built in the same design.
Since the structure of the stone chamber is much similar to that of Midoro Kita-kofun Tumulus (Gose City), it is said to be built in the same design.
Since the structure of the stone chamber is much similar to that of Midoro Kita-kofun Tumulus (Gose City), it is said to be built in the same design.

sen.j: 1958年の発掘調査では石室内部からは凝灰岩製の組合せ式の家形石棺が3基が発見された。
sen.e: In the excavation and research in 1958, three sets of iegata sekkan (house-shaped stone coffin) made of tuff were discovered from the rock chamber.
In the excavation and research in 1958, three sets of iegata sekkan (house-shaped stone coffin) made of tuff were discovered inside the stone chamber.
In the excavation and research in 1958, three sets of iegata sekkan (house-shaped stone coffin) made of tuff were discovered inside the stone chamber.

sen.j: そのほか、 須恵器なども出土した。
sen.e: Additionally sueki (unglazed ware) was excavated.
Additionally sueki (unglazed ware) and so on was excavated.
Additionally sueki (unglazed ware) and so on was excavated.

sen.j: この時の調査のさいには羨道部分から鉄製の釘も出土しており、木棺が追葬されていた可能性もある。
sen.e: As steel nails were excavated during this excavation, there is a possibility that wooden coffins were additionally buried.
As steel nails were excavated from the passage during this excavation, there is a possibility that wooden coffins were additionally buried.
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ。「羨道部分から」を補足しました。
sen.e: As steel nails were excavated from the passage during this excavation, there is a possibility that wooden coffins were additionally buried.

sen.j: 築造時期は出土品などから古墳時代後期、7世紀初頭と考えられている。
sen.e: It is estimated to be constructed in the latter Kofun period (tumulus period) or the beginning of the 7th century from its artifacts and other facts.
It is estimated to be constructed in the latter Kofun period (tumulus period) or the beginning of the seventh century from its artifacts and other facts.
It is estimated to be constructed in the latter Kofun period (tumulus period) or the beginning of the seventh century from its artifacts and other facts.

sen.j: 現在は田に囲まれた中の柿畑となっており、古墳と認識するのも困難である。
sen.e: Today it is a persimmon field surrounded by rice fields and it is difficult to recognize it as a tumulus.
Today it becomes a persimmon field surrounded by rice fields and it is difficult to recognize it as a tumulus.
Today it becomes a persimmon field surrounded by rice fields and it is difficult to recognize it as a tumulus.

sen.j: 石室内はかつて農機具置き場として使われていたこともある。
sen.e: Its rock chamber was once used as a storage space of farming equipments.
The stone chamber was once used as a storage space of farming equipments.
The stone chamber was once used as a storage space of farming equipments.

sen.j: 茅原大墓古墳（国史跡） - 本古墳より北北東約300メートルにある。
sen.e: Chihara Obaka Tumulus (national historical site): located 300 m north-northeast of this tumulus.
Chihara Obaka-kofun Tumulus (national historical site): Located 300 meters north-northeast of this tumulus.
Chihara Obaka-kofun Tumulus (national historical site): Located 300 meters north-northeast of this tumulus.
